page.title: 16Ecology(2)
page.content: Rudhall Brook flows through our area.It was from this brook the monks of Eccleswall diverted some water to form their fish pond. The brook was not in good condition, the sides were overgrown and there was mud everywhere.There was a waterfall about half way down,you could just see it through the bushes.The water was fast flowing and in some places the water was about three feet deep. We did not see any fish in the brook but if there were any in there it would not be any good for fishing because there were a lot of sticks and branches in the way and you would get your line caught up. We found snakes'holes by the brook on the bank.There was evidence that people walked along the footpaths by the brook;there were footprints and bridges over the brook made of planks.
